definition: finger/to point at or to/to indicate or refer to/to depend on/to count on/(of hair) to stand on end

first of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/(used for an unspecified person or thing)/first (in a list, as a party to a contract etc)/letter "A" or roman "I" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/armor plating/shell or carapace/(of the fingers or toes) nail/bladed leather or metal armor (old)/ranking system used in the Imperial examinations (old)/civil administration unit in the baojia 保甲[bao3 jia3] system (old)/ancient Chinese compass point: 75°
knife/blade/single-edged sword/cutlass/CL:把[ba3]/(slang) dollar (loanword)/classifier for sets of one hundred sheets (of paper)/classifier for knife cuts or stabs

sentences.english: Trim toenails straight across using nail clippers.
sentences.chinese: 用指甲刀逐個修剪腳趾甲。

sentences.english: Also, pay attention to in life separate towels and nail clippers.
sentences.chinese: 另外，在生活中要注意毛巾和指甲刀分開。

sentences.english: You need handkerchiefs, soap and a nail clipper.
sentences.chinese: 你需要手絹，肥皂和指甲刀。

sentences.english: You don't have to take a shower every day.
sentences.chinese: 你不一定要隨身拿一個指甲刀修剪指甲。

sentences.english: The use is convenient, and the utility model is a pair of ideal sanitary nail clippers.
sentences.chinese: 它使用方便，是比較理想的衛生指甲刀。

sentences.english: The nail clippers are very sharp.
sentences.chinese: 這個指甲刀十分地鋒利。

sentences.english: She was paring her nails with nail scissors .
sentences.chinese: 她正在用指甲刀修指甲。
